section.title: Introduction
section.p: The Elver project focuses on combining code, persistency and UI generation solutions. Elver Persistency implements persistency solutions for generated Java objects by integrating code generation frameworks and existing persistency technologies.

section.title: Elver Persistency moves to Eclipse.org as Teneo within EMFT

p.strong: Elver persistency is in the process of moving to eclipse.org. Elver persistency will be continued as the Teneo project in the EMFT project. The current status:

ul.li: The source code has been moved to Eclipse cvs. The new main java package name: org.eclipse.emf.teneo.
Currently we are working on the build process.
Support is given on both the EMFT newsgroup as the Elver mailinglist. When the build process at eclipse.org is operational, support will move completely to the EMFT newsgroup.

section.title: EMF Persistency
section.p: Integrating EMF with existing persistency solutions, combines the power of a code generation framework like EMF and the power of storage, caching and querying of sophisticated object-relational mapping and persistency software.
EMF has been integrated with two persistency solutions:

Hibernate: The EMF - Hibernate integration (alpha status) has just been released and supports persisting of basic EObjects, ELists with 1:n, n:m, one-way, two-way and contained relations. EMF Objects can be retrieved using HQL queries.

JDO/JPOX: The EMF - JPOX integration (alpha status) supports all EMF and JDO 2.0/JPOX features. EMF objects can be persisted in most major relational databases and retrieved using an EMF resource approach or advanced JDOQL queries.
